description: System-generated unique identifier for a cataloged database object (module, table, or column). Used to reference the object and relate it to parent or child objects.
Business-friendly name of the cataloged object in the fleet system (e.g., module, table, view, or column).
Code indicating the kind of object (likely module/table/view/column); confirm with SME. Drives which attributes (e.g., data type, length) are applicable.
Identifier of this object's immediate parent in the object hierarchy. 0/NULL typically means no parent or a top-level object.
Free-text or HTML summary of the object’s purpose and business function within fleet operations or integrations.
When the object is a column, the database data type assigned to its values (e.g., integer, varchar, date). Otherwise not applicable.
For column objects, the maximum length, precision, or scale permitted by the data type. Often 0 when not applicable.
Boolean flag indicating the column participates in the table’s primary key when the object represents a column.
Boolean flag identifying the column as a foreign key that references another table when applicable.
Indicates whether the column allows NULL values (i.e., may be left blank). Applies only to column objects.
Name of the corresponding table in the web application or integration layer used for mapping; likely populated for objects exposed on the web; confirm with SME.
Mapping definition from this database column to its web/API field name or path; used for data exchange or UI binding. Likely only for column objects.
Human-readable notes explaining the web/data mapping, transformation rules, or usage context.
Identifier for the related web-layer table used in mappings; pairs with the named web table to link cataloged objects to their web representation.
